fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Climate Action
inter_groups: We are actively monitoring and are interested in the European Parliament's inter-group on Long-Term Investment and Reindustrialisation.
eu_initiatives:
Swiss Re is engaged on a range of issues which impact the insurance industry including: 
 
- Solvency II 
- Recovery and Resolution for (re) insurers 
- Capital Markets Union 
- Digital Single Market  
- Cyber Security Standards 
- Data Protection  
- Climate Change 
- Insurance and Man-made Disasters  
- Financial Transactions Tax 
- European Market Infrastructure Regulation (EMIR) 
- Gender Directive 
- Anti Discrimination Directive

goals__remit: The Swiss Re Group is a leading wholesale provider of reinsurance, insurance and other insurance-based forms of risk transfer. Dealing direct and working through brokers, its global client base consists of insurance companies, mid-to-large-sized corporations and public sector clients. From standard products to tailor-made coverage across all lines of business, Swiss Re deploys its capital strength, expertise and innovation power to enable the risk taking upon which enterprise and progress in society depend.
position: Head of EMEA Regulatory Risk Management
